title: Crimea Marches

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: You have done excellent work, Ike. Thanks to you, the wound that has scarred Begnion for many long years can finally begin to heal. As promised, Begnion now offers its support to Crimea's restoration. However, Prime Minister Sephiran has yet to return, which limits the reinforcements I can provide. Be that as it may, what troops I can spare await your command. Use them as you see fit.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: I understand. Thank you. That's good news, isn't it, Princess Elincia?

dialogue.speaker: Elincia
dialogue.line: Yes. Yes it is.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: This has taught me a valuable lesson...Our land needs the laguz. I also believe that beorc and laguz need each other to survive. The previous apostle, my grandmother, was desirous of such a world, as were my own parents. Princess Elincia, your father, King Ramon of Crimea, was a true pioneer in the area of beorc-laguz relations. In the very near future, I will give the imperial senate a few...suggestions on achieving a fully integrated society. I doubt the road will be easily traveled, but I can no longer turn a blind eye to these issues. Princess Elincia, you must rebuild Crimea. If you are sucessful, we will join forces and change the world.

dialogue.speaker: Elincia
dialogue.line: Empress Sanaki, your vision surpasses even my own... My father would be so pleased to hear your words.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Looks like you're through with me. I'll wait outside until you're finished talking.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: Hold! I am most definitely NOT through with you.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Huh? What did I do now?

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: You're as impudent and impatient as ever. Heed me, Ike. If you are to help lead the Crimean Liberation Army, you must be given a more appropriate title.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: If you're talking about making me a noble, I'll decline, thanks. That's not my kind of thing.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: You are not in a position to refuse. Giving some nameless mercenary control of Begnion's troops would be...problematic. And more importantly, it would affect the troops. You will resign yourself to this and receive peerage from Princess Elincia.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: What? No, wait! This is absurd...Blast! Of all the foolish...

dialogue.speaker: Elincia
dialogue.line: I'm...sorry about this. If you're absolutely opposed to it, I won't force you.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: No, I have to do what's necessary. What am I supposed to do now?  Put on a funny hat or something?

dialogue.speaker: Elincia
dialogue.line: Um, will you...lend me your sword? Thank you. Now, may I ask you...to kneel before me?

dialogue.speaker: Elincia
dialogue.line: Th-thank you. All right... Let me begin. In the name of House Crimea, I hereby grant you the title and rank of lord and all the honors it conveys. Rise, Lord Ike.

dialogue.speaker: Elincia
dialogue.line: It is done.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: What an odd feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: Aha! Your new rank suits you.

dialogue.speaker: Sigrun
dialogue.line: I completely agree.

dialogue.speaker: Elincia
dialogue.line: Yes, it truly does...

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Hmm... I suppose. Not that it matters to me.

opening: Western Begnion is home to a great forest.

As the first snow of the season falls, the newly commissioned General Ike takes control of the Crimean Liberation Army. He leads it toward the knife-edged mountains that mark the border between Begnion and Daein.
At one time these woods were home to the kingdom of Serenes and ruled by the heron clan of the bird tribes.

Following the Serenes Massacre, the forest lost its color and vitality. Some said it was the sorrow of the goddess made real. For twenty long years, the devout citizens of Begnion trembled in shame and loathing over the crime they had committed.
The Begnion Empress, Apostle Sanaki, stepped forward as representative of her countrymen.
Kneeling before the surviving heron prince and princess, she gave voice to the apology of her people.

She spoke not as one nation to another but as neighbors on the same continent. The massacre was unforgivable. However, hatred breeds hatred, and if the cycle of grief and anger is not broken, it will continue for time without end. It was with this in mind that the herons accepted the apostle's apology.
And so it was that Serenes Forest was returned to its former glory.
Afterward as payment for Ike's service, Princess Elincia gained the services of a regiment of Begnion army regulars.
Though of common birth Ike receives peerage from the princess and is given command of the army.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: So they've left Begnion, have they?

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: According to our spy, they march with a regiment of Begnion's army. They plan to take a land route through Daein and then into Crimea.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Hah! They plan to cut across Daein? With nothing more than a single regiment at whose core is a tattered band of ragtag mercenaries? Gawain's son leads this rabble, yes? How does he stand up to his father's legacy?

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: He doesn't. He's just a boy, not yet worthy of his father's name.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Hmph. Disappointing.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Though his skill with the blade is rough, there is something...uncanny about him. People seem drawn to him. And not just Begnion's apostle, either. He's also gained the trust of the Serenes survivors...and of King Phoenicis as well.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: The herons are alive?

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: It appears that two members of the royal family survived.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Heh heh... Look how nicely the table's been set for us. Bring one of them to me... I care not which one. And I want the medallion as well.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: ...As you wish.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Once we cross that great wall, we'll be in Daein. Look there, atop that building!...Daein wyvern riders on patrol. They won't be happy to see us.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: Tell me, General Ike, have you faced wyvern riders in combat?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Only a few times. I got the impression that the Kilvas ravens were the more dangerous foe.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: If that's your impression, then you have yet to fight true wyvern riders.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What do you mean?

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: I have no way of judging the ones we see here, but I know another unit, one that was attached to Begnion's temple guard. They had their reasons for leaving... But the important thing to remember is that they are exceedingly powerful.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Which explains why the apostle sent you to accompany us.

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: That's right. Pegasus knights fare better than most against wyvern riders. We know the skies as well as they do.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yeah, I prefer to keep my feet on the ground, thank you. Can I entrust the flying business to you?

intro.speaker: Tanith
intro.line: Of course. We'll bring honor to the name of the apostle's sacred guards.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My lord Ike. Are preparations complete?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes. The enemy should not yet be aware that we've come this far. We're going to launch a surprise attack and try to capture the wall on our first charge. Please wait for us at the base camp.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Very well...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: There's no need to look so worried. We're well prepared. And we've got you as our good luck charm.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Thank you for that, but...Do be careful, my lord Ike.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hey, don't worry! This may be our first battle as an official army, but we've fought Daein many times. We're going to win. After all, I can't lose my very first battle as a snooty noble, now can I?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I believe in you, and I know that you will be victorious. Come back safe.

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: It appears the Crimean army has arrived. It's time to put our plan into action.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: The main body of the Kilvas army will wait atop the western summit. A small unit will remain here and cooperate with you. This is correct, is it not?

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: Mm, it is.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: What could His Majesty be thinking? Why does Daein ally herself with some backwater sub-human nation?

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: ...I don't know. There's no way we can expect to understand the supreme thoughts of the king. All we can do is perform the tasks set before us by His Highness. That is everything.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Yes, of course!

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: The Crimean army has no idea we're aware of their every move. Bah! What vermin... What does that untrained group of vagabonds think they can do? I don't care how talented he is. Their commander is nothing more than a young mercenary with delusions of grandeur. We've nothing to fear.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: We'll show them what real war is like! And...the Kilvas ravens? How should we deal with them?

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: Those sub-human freaks! Let's use them as bait. We can sacrifice them and reduce our own human casualties.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: A fantastic idea!

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: Make sure that the men are thoroughly instructed.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: You there! Halt! Mmm...you're an unfamiliar face.

intro.speaker: Shinon
intro.line: You'll know it soon enough.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Y-you filthy piece of offal! You will bow your head to a superior officer!

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: He's got a lot of nerve, hasn't he? Is he one of yours?

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir! He's a new recruit who was only assigned to me today. Please accept my apologies for his lack of any training or manners whatsoever.

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: If he's good, I can overlook almost any character flaw. Go and kill as many Crimeans as you can! Help my name be remembered with honor and glory.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Shinon
intro.line: ...Pah.

intro.speaker: Kayachey
intro.line: Come to me, dregs of Crimea! I will teach what it means to oppose the might of Daein.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Is everyone ready? Let's move out!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Hold a moment, my lord Ike! In the sky...something's coming!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Who's that?

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Ah, Ike! Well met. It appears that you're getting ready for your first battle as Crimea's army.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: And you're escorting the heron siblings back to Phoenicis, right?

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: That was the original plan, but...Someone here insisted that we follow you. Quite unreasonably, I might add.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: You treated us with courtesy, beorc. We must act accordingly. Isn't that so, Leanne?

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Yes, Yes, brother.)

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: You said your name was Ike, correct?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: You aided my sister and me during a time of danger. We herons hold courtesy in high esteem. We must repay our debt to you.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That's really not necessary.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: We are practitioners of seid magic. We cannot fight, but we can imbue our allies with strength. If you so wish it, I will travel with you. In this way I will repay you for what you have done.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You were lucky to find your sister; shouldn't you stay by her side?

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Leanne understands what I do.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I see. In that case, welcome.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Thank you. I swear on the honor of my clan to do all I can to strengthen your cause.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: It's settled then. And you'll get aid from me as well. Janaff!

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: Right here, Your Majesty!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: You'll go with the Crimean army and protect Reyson.

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: Leave it to me!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: You, too, Ulki. All right?

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Tibarn! It's too much, I cannot accept this. You're already watching over Leanne and my father as well.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: These past twenty years... I know what it's been like for you living in Phoenicis. I'm only sorry I can't do more.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Tibarn... I thank you, from the bottom of my heart.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: King Phoenicis, I will guard Reyson well. When Crimea is retaken, I will see him safely returned to you.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: I will take you at your word. Your actions have created a bond of trust between yourselves and the hawk and heron clans. If you find yourself in a dire position, you can call on me. No matter what, I will fly to your aid.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: We gained a strong ally where we had not thought to look for one, didn't we?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes. Beorc and laguz...Beast tribe and bird tribe...There's no difference between us. We finally understand one another.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Yes, I think you're right.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Now, let's really get started! Everyone, move out!

battle.speaker: Janaff
battle.line: Hey, hey! What are those stupid crows doing here?

battle.speaker: Reyson
battle.line: Ravens! They betray not only me, but all laguz! Naesala, you dastard...

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: Shi-Shinon? Ohmigosh...Why are you with the Daein army?!

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: But that's... Oh, what should I do? You used to be one of us. I can't fight you!

battle-talk.speaker: Shinon
battle-talk.line: Stop whining. Didn't you ever think what it means to be a mercenary? We're enemies, kid. Get it? I'm ready to fight when you are. So what's it going to be?

battle-talk.speaker: Shinon
battle-talk.line: Gah! What ARE you going to do then?

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: Come back to the Greil Mercenaries!

battle-talk.speaker: Mist
battle-talk.line: If you won't do that, then come work for the Crimean army! Please?

battle-talk.speaker: Shinon
battle-talk.line: Don't be stupid. Either way, Ike's in charge, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Shinon
battle-talk.line: I won't work for him. Get it? We used to be friends, so I'm going to let you go. Now get your naive little butt out of here!

battle-talk.speaker: Shinon
battle-talk.line: Crying's not going to help. Look, it doesn't matter who you send to talk to me. My answer's the same.

battle-talk.speaker: Shinon
battle-talk.line: ...Yeah. Even Rolf. Get out of here. The next time I see you, I'll stick an arrow in you. Count on it.

recruit-talk.speaker: Shinon
recruit-talk.line: Look at you. You've grown so much...You actually look like an archer.

recruit-talk.speaker: Shinon
recruit-talk.line: You always did have what it takes. It's just like I told you--you train the right way, and you'll surpass both your brothers.

recruit-talk.speaker: Shinon
recruit-talk.line: Yeah, you did. You...haven't told anyone else about that, have you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Rolf
recruit-talk.line: Nope. Never said a word. I keep my promises.

recruit-talk.speaker: Shinon
recruit-talk.line: Stop that. I told you things like this happen. Did you forget?

recruit-talk.speaker: Shinon
recruit-talk.line: Ready your bow. It's time for the pupil to face his master.

boss.speaker: Kayachey
boss.line: And now you will realize the true power of Daein!

recruit-battle.speaker: Shinon
recruit-battle.line: ...My arrows will find you no matter where you run.

recruit-battle.speaker: Shinon
recruit-battle.line: Unh.........Messed that up, didn't I...Man...what a...lousy life...that was...

recruit-battle.speaker: Ike
recruit-battle.line: Don't move. You'll tear the wound wide open.

recruit-battle.speaker: Shinon
recruit-battle.line: What're you planning? D-do it...now...Finish me.

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: Crud, I lost... This was a plum chance for me to get a leg up in this world, too.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Shinon.

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: Ha! And I can't believe that the one who defeats me is little lord Ikie. Looks like I've lost my edge. I'm ready, boy. Go on. Finish what you started.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Come back to the company.

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: I don't think so.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You've never liked me. As far back as I can remember, you have never liked me.

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: That's right. Still don't.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You... You called me a weakling. Said I was nothing without the help of my father. That's what you said, right? That's why you hated me.

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: ...Sounds like me.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Don't you get it? I just beat you. So your reasons don't hold water anymore, do they?

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: Pah! It's enough you beat me, now you gotta talk me to death?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I'll say it once more. Come back to the company. I acknowledge your abilities. As commander, I want you with us.

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: ...Let's have another go around. I win, and I'm commander. Agreed?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I win, and you fall in line. Agreed?

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: Don't worry, boy. I'll make it quick.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Let's go.

end.speaker: Begnion Soldier
end.line: General! We've seized control of the surrounding area, and the remaining Daein troops are retreating... General?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Oh, right. Understood.

end.speaker: Begnion Soldier
end.line: I beg your leave.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: General, eh? Weird.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: You know, you never look relaxed.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Nasir. What's going on? We haven't seen much of you lately.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: I've been a bit busy. In order to leave Begnion, I had to sell my ship and dismiss the crew...There was a lot to take care of.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Is that so? Heh. It looks like you've been caught up in our struggle after all. Are you all right with that? I mean, I know you've got a lot of your own matters to handle.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: It's not like I've abandoned my own interests to join up with the Crimean army. For me, I've judged that there's value in traveling with you. So, don't worry about it overly much.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: If you say so. You're a fairly knowledgable fellow, so it's nice having you around.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Ha! I think that's mutual. Now then, I've got some good news.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Senior officials in Gallia are moving to action. Until now, they've been content to take a defensive stance and wait it out, but... It appears this neverending stalemate has exhausted their patience. Ike, this victory here today was a very important thing. It may prove to be a decisive first step in breaking Daein's power. News of it will spread like wildfire over the entire continent and give countries confidence to speak out against Daein. With Crimea as a rallying point, Gallia may well be moved to join this war. You just need to keep winning. If you can do that, the road will open before you.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: History will be made...Could Daein truly fall at our hands? Can I make that happen? Me?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Use what you've been given, and great things will happen. You have it in you to lead, Ike. For now, it's merely one portion of the bird tribes, but...your relationship is established. It's because you resolved to gain their trust, and then made it happen.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: It's all due to my father...If my actions prove to be the right ones, it will be due to the way my father raised me. If you treat others in good faith, they will follow you of their own volition. That's what he taught me.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: He was a magnificent man, wasn't he?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: When I was younger, I wanted nothing more than to be as strong as my father. And then I wanted to surpass him...Now, that is a goal I'll never achieve.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: What's that? The border's been breached?

end.speaker: Raven Laguz
end.line: Everyone was defeated. Not only the Daein troops, but our brigade as well. Cut down like wheat in a field.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Huh! Well, that was impressively done. Er, for a band of sellswords, that is. There's nothing else to do. Send a message to the Daein command and tell them the enemy is stronger than expected.

end.speaker: Raven Laguz
end.line: At once.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Wait! Hold a moment.

end.speaker: Raven Laguz
end.line: Yes?

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Send a Daein human instead. I don't care which one. Just don't use any of our troops.

end.speaker: Raven Laguz
end.line: But a wingless human will take such a long time to--

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: General Petrine commands the next front. She's a very...temperamental woman... But go if you like! Tell her that the Kilvas ravens have been defeated... She'll roast you like a chicken and use your bones for stock!

end.speaker: Raven Laguz
end.line: Un-understood! I will find a human!

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Who's there?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Soren? What are you doing here?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: What are you planning?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Where did that come from? I've no idea what you're talking about.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Don't play dumb with me. We're past that. Gallia's decision to join in this war was based on some new information they received, wasn't it?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Cat got your tongue? Fine. I'll tell you what you've been doing here... You were to deliver Princess Crimea to Begnion to see if she could garner any support for her cause. And--regardless of whether she got that assistance or not--to judge if she was worthy of laguz support. Am I wrong?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: If you've figured all of this out, why remain silent?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Because your actions were beneficial to Princess Crimea. I determined that even if left to your own devices, you would not harm the princess.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: It sounds like you don't think that's the case anymore.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: You accomplished both missions, but you've come back anyway. To what end?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: I don't have to explain myself to you.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: That's true only until I reveal your purpose to Ike.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Everyone has a secret or two that he wants to bury somewhere deep. Including you...Soren.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: ...I don't know what you mean.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Oh, I trust that we understand each other. The army rises early tomorrow. I suggest we turn in.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: The enemy knew we were coming today.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: And you think I'm responsible?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Yes, I do.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: My, oh, my... You really ARE suspicious, aren't you? Good night, Soren.

conversation.speaker: Begnion Soldier
conversation.line: General Ike. All troops are ready to move out.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: All right. Can you have them wait?

conversation.speaker: Begnion Soldier
conversation.line: Do you want them to fall out and wait in their tents? Or would you rather they form up and stand at attention?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Go ahead and have them stand down. I'll call them when I'm ready.

conversation.speaker: Begnion Soldier
conversation.line: Yes, sir!

conversation.speaker: Begnion Soldier
conversation.line: Begging your pardon, sir! All troops have been ordered to stand down. However, General Tanith requests her orders. Are her pegasus knights to stand down as well?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Am I supposed to decide that, too?

conversation.speaker: Begnion Soldier
conversation.line: General Ike... You've been given command of the entire army, sir. We will not move without your orders, sir.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: General Tanith's troops...are to follow General Tanith's orders.

conversation.speaker: Begnion Soldier
conversation.line: Understood, sir! General Tanith's pegasus knights will not be deployed unless there is a request for reinforcements. Those are the orders of General Tanith. By your leave, sir!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Tanith, do you have a moment?

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: General Ike. What is it? Is there a problem?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I thought you might be able to provide me with some information.

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Yes?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What can you tell me about King Daein? I'd like to know something of him before I have to face him in battle.

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Truth be told, I've never fought him, either. I cannot give you any specifics, but I will tell you what little I do know.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Please. Whatever you can tell me would be appreciated.

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Ashnard's coronation, let me see... Yes, it was eighteen years ago. You see, a plague had struck the capital, spreading out to affect the surrounding region of Nevassa and beyond. Ashnard was crowned the year after that great tragedy finally subsided. In the entire history of Tellius, no calamity has claimed the lives of so many beorc and laguz--not since the great flood. Two years before, it struck Begnion, and the entire population of Serenes was nearly obliterated. The year after that, close to a thousand beorc--nobles and peasants alike--perished in Daein.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Nobles, you say? So the royal family fell victim to this plague as well?

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Yes. The reigning king and queen and some twenty or so princes and princesses fell ill. And everyone who fell ill perished. For a time, the people despaired of losing the entire royal bloodline of Daein. It seemed that none would survive.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: And yet Ashnard survived.

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: He did. It is quite interesting, in a sense. You see, his name was never mentioned in any talk of succession before that time. He was of such a distant bloodline that he was unlikely to be king. In another place though, his name was already well known.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Where was that?

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: On the battlefield. As you know, Daein is home to many brave warriors. At the time, then-prince Ashnard was said to have been a match for an entire troop of pegasus knights. Begnion and Daein both keep close watch over their borders, and their patrols fought in many skirmishes. Although there was no war to speak of, these land disputes did end with Daein claiming a small portion of Begnion soil. It would be no exaggeration to say this was soley due to the strength of one man: Ashnard.

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Forgive me. I have spoken longer than I intended. It's about time we get back to the business of marching preparations.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: No, thank you for telling me so much. If we have another chance, please share more of your stories.

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Understood.

conversation.speaker: Tormod
conversation.line: Ike! Which troop should we fall in with? We have received no orders yet.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Tormod, Muarim, I know I've asked you many times, but...Are you sure you want to be here?

conversation.speaker: Tormod
conversation.line: You keep asking that! Maybe you don't want us here.  Is that it? I don't know what to think!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: No, it's not that at all. To be honest, the battle ahead is going to be hard... It looks bleak. I'd rather that those without direct ties to Crimea not get involved.

conversation.speaker: Tormod
conversation.line: A bleak battle? What about trying to free all the slaves in Begnion? Now THOSE were bleak battles. Bleak battles are our specialty. Right, Muarim?

conversation.speaker: Muarim
conversation.line: Yes, you are. Yet...thanks to Ike's time in Begnion, things have changed completely.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That's right. The apostle has promised to press her investigation until there's not a single laguz slave left in the entire nation. So, there's no reason for you two to continue fighting, is there? You don't owe me anything--

conversation.speaker: Tormod
conversation.line: We're going to fight with you, Ike. We want to help!

conversation.speaker: Muarim
conversation.line: It is our right to join you in this. Just as it is your right to refuse us.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: To be perfectly frank, I would be willing to beg to get you to join us. Both of you, all right?

conversation.speaker: Muarim
conversation.line: All right.

conversation.speaker: Tormod
conversation.line: Ha ha! You can count on us!
